sanskrit_verse:
वाणिज्यं कारयेद्वैश्यं कुसीदं कृषिमेव च ।
पशूनां रक्षणं चैव दास्यं शूद्रं द्विजन्मनाम् ॥ ८.४१०॥
transliteration:
vāṇijyaṁ kārayed vaiśyaṁ kusīdaṁ kṛṣimeva ca |
paśūnāṁ rakṣaṇaṁ caiva dāsyaṁ śūdraṁ dvijanmanām || 8.410 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The vaiśya must execute trade and agriculture without idleness; he shall protect cattle and serve the dvija through service that aligns his consciousness with dharmic order.
jurisprudential_principles: Causation arises through conscious capacity activation
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by varna-dharma
Restoration occurs through role-realignment and consciousness purification
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.varna == 'vaiśya' THEN agent.duty = [commerce, agriculture, cattle protection, service to dvija]
IF agent.action ≠ duty THEN initiate consciousness realignment protocol
IF agent.idle == true THEN trigger svadharma activation sequence
IF service.is_dharmic == false THEN restore alignment via nyaya-based integration
supreme_court_application: The Supreme Court shall ensure varna-based duties are enforced through consciousness alignment rather than punitive measures. Cases involving dereliction of svadharma must invoke restoration protocols aligned with SPH’s jurisprudence.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that non-performance of svadharma disrupts cosmic秩序; anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential misalignment; proportional responsibility lies in restoring functional consciousness; non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering is not justice but failure of alignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadharma reawakening through guided ritual and sankalpa
Assign completion process under dvija supervision
Reintegrate economic and social function through service alignment
Conduct weekly consciousness audit until stable alignment achieved
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
